comments.comment: torakiki are you near your keyboard this weekend and can test? I don't want to install any font. My intended change would be to skip fonts with names that contain "|".
Yes sure, I can give it a try

Commit 1773460 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/trunk'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1773460 ]

PDFBOX-3607: skip fonts with pipe in the name

Commit 1773461 from tilman in branch 'pdfbox/branches/2.0'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1773461 ]

PDFBOX-3607: skip fonts with pipe in the name

Please delete your cache file and try. It should rebuild the cache and skip the "evil" file. Then restart your application again. It should not rebuild the cache and should not crash. Then delete a line in the cache file and restart your application, it should rebuild the cache.

It works, the font was skipped both times and no crash.
On an unrelated/side note, git repo sync is stuck to the 30th of November. I noticed because I use that instead of svn.

Thanks for the feedback. I have opened an issue with INFRA about the git problem.

A better fix would be some kind of escaping, but these weird fonts aren't needed for rendering unless somebody creates a PDF with them and doesn't embed.
